Key Match Events: Castellanos hit a walk-off single in the ninth inning, scoring Trea Turner and giving the Phillies a 7-6 win.
Bryce Harper hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning, tying the game.
Bryson Stott hit a two-run triple in the eighth inning, putting the Phillies ahead 6-4.
Mark Vientos hit a pair of two-run homers for the Mets.
Pete Alonso and Brandon Nimmo hit solo homers for the Mets.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos expressed that the game will live long in Philly sports lore.
Bryce Harper said, 'Rocky would be proud,' referring to his never-die mentality.
Carlos Mendoza, Mets manager, said, 'No excuses. It's been hard, but here we are.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second postseason meeting between the NL East rivals.
Phillies' Aaron Nola and Mets' Sean Manaea will start in Game 3.
The game lasted 3 hours and 13 minutes.
